channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: White van with no number plates, front or rear, 29th January
item.description:
Unmarked white van has been parked on the corner of Rosehill and Coltham Rd for 2 days. No number plates, front or rear
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Coltham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waitrose trolley and Iceland trolley full of rubbish Abingdon Road car Park, 29th January
item.description:
The Iceland trolley has been around for weeks because it is from the Iceland superstore on Tewkesbury Road and not from the local Iceland it is getting progressively worse. Please ask the borough council to come and pick them both up. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 62-66 Edinburgh Place, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Still missing road sign, 26th January
item.description:
Still no road sign explaining what each lane is for before the roundabout. All other junctions have it before entry besides this one. Constantly people confused, changing lanes, and causing accidents due to the missing signage
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Longlevens
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Invisible road markings, 26th January
item.description:
The road markings on the roundabout have completely faded away. reported multiple times, extremely dangerous, multiple accidents Repaint it now!!!!!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elm Bridge Court, Longlevens
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass, 26th January
item.description:

item.title: Traffic light timings need amending, 26th January
item.description:
A40 Lansdown Road / Christ Church Road junction. Green light for traffic exiting Christ Church Road onto A40 remains green for less than 10 seconds - additional traffic is using Christ Church Road (and Queens Road) to access A40 whilst Gloucester Road junction with A40 is shut (for months). As a result at peak times (AM and PM) traffic builds up at / across the Queens Road / Christ Church Road traffic lights due to traffic queuing at end of Christ Church Road. Green light timing needs to be increased (at least doubled) to allow more traffic to clear Christ Church Road onto A40.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Ablington Lansdown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement obstruction, 26th January
item.description:
Completely overgrown forcing pedestrians into 40mph road to get past

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Rockholme Coach House Leckhampton Hill, Leckhampton Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 200 yards of potholrs, 25th January
item.description:
There is a stretch of very dangerous uneven road under the trees. I‚Äôm sure it used to be many potholes but it‚Äôs now so bad they‚Äôve just merged into one huge piece of really bad road. They keep coming and filling the occasional hole but there are hundreds more. You now cannot pass this road and avoid them. Have reported many times.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Asda tray of broken yoghurt pots on Tennyson Road roundabout, 25th January
item.description:
It looks to me like the Asda driver has found broken yoghurt in his van and just left it on the pavement. Of course there is the outside possibility that it was stolen but I think that‚Äôs unlikely

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Jesse Mary Chambers Tennyson Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Dangerous deep potholes, 25th January
item.description:
Hi, There are two really big & deep potholes about 100 yards before the exit to the M5 roundabout off the Golden Valley going towards Gloucester from Cheltenham. Please assess and fix ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, The Reddings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 24 inch wide pothole, 25th January
item.description:
This pothole has been by the island at the top of Back Lane for over a month and is getting bigger by the week, if a motorcycle or pushbike hit it they would fall off
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Oddfellows Terrace Back Lane, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
